a.title: Legend for this format

title.value: Cross-version Extension `R5.SubstanceDefinition.relationship` for use in FHIR R4

description.value: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship` for use in FHIR R4.

purpose.value:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship` as defined in FHIR R5 in FHIR R4.
The source element is defined as: `SubstanceDefinition.relationship` 0..* `BackboneElement`
Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as: * R5: `SubstanceDefinition.relationship` 0..* `BackboneElement` * R4B: `SubstanceDefinition.relationship` 0..* `BackboneElement` * R4: `SubstanceSpecification.relationship` 0..* `BackboneElement`
Following are the generation technical comments: Element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `SubstanceSpecification.relationship`, but has no comparisons.

short.value: A link between this substance and another

definition.value: A link between this substance and another, with details of the relationship.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: Unique id for inter-element referencing

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: An Extension

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: A pointer to another substance, as a resource or a representational code

definition.value: A pointer to another substance, as a resource or just a representational code.

requirements.value: Element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship.substanceDefinition[x]` is part of an existing definition because parent element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship` requires a cross-version extension. Element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship.substanceDefinition[x]` has a context of SubstanceSpecification.relationship based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `SubstanceSpecification`.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

short.value: Additional content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: identifies the meaning of the extension

definition.value: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

comment.value: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

short.value: A pointer to another substance, as a resource or a representational code

definition.value: A pointer to another substance, as a resource or just a representational code.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: For example "salt to parent", "active moiety"

definition.value: For example "salt to parent", "active moiety", "starting material", "polymorph", "impurity of".

requirements.value: Element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship.type` is part of an existing definition because parent element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship` requires a cross-version extension. Element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship.type` has a context of SubstanceSpecification.relationship based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `SubstanceSpecification`.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

description.value: The relationship between two substance types.

short.value: For example where an enzyme strongly bonds with a particular substance, this is a defining relationship for that enzyme, out of several possible relationships

definition.value: For example where an enzyme strongly bonds with a particular substance, this is a defining relationship for that enzyme, out of several possible substance relationships.

requirements.value: Element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship.isDefining` is part of an existing definition because parent element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship` requires a cross-version extension. Element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship.isDefining` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `SubstanceSpecification.relationship.isDefining`, but has no comparisons.

short.value: For example where an enzyme strongly bonds with a particular substance, this is a defining relationship for that enzyme, out of several possible relationships

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: A numeric factor for the relationship, e.g. that a substance salt has some percentage of active substance in relation to some other

definition.value: A numeric factor for the relationship, for instance to express that the salt of a substance has some percentage of the active substance in relation to some other.

requirements.value: Element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship.amount[x]` is part of an existing definition because parent element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship` requires a cross-version extension. Note that the target element context `SubstanceSpecification.relationship.amount[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `SubstanceSpecification.relationship`. Element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship.amount[x]` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `SubstanceSpecification.relationship.amount[x]`, but has no comparisons. Note that the target element context `SubstanceSpecification.relationship.amount[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `SubstanceSpecification.relationship`.

Element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship.substanceDefinition[x]` has a context of SubstanceSpecification.relationship based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `SubstanceSpecification`.

short.value: A pointer to another substance, as a resource or a representational code

short.value: For example "salt to parent", "active moiety"

description.value: The relationship between two substance types.

short.value: For example where an enzyme strongly bonds with a particular substance, this is a defining relationship for that enzyme, out of several possible relationships

definition.value: For example where an enzyme strongly bonds with a particular substance, this is a defining relationship for that enzyme, out of several possible substance relationships.

requirements.value: Element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship.isDefining` is part of an existing definition because parent element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship` requires a cross-version extension. short.value: For example where an enzyme strongly bonds with a particular substance, this is a defining relationship for that enzyme, out of several possible relationships

definition.value: For example where an enzyme strongly bonds with a particular substance, this is a defining relationship for that enzyme, out of several possible substance relationships.

short.value: A numeric factor for the relationship, e.g. that a substance salt has some percentage of active substance in relation to some other

definition.value: A numeric factor for the relationship, for instance to express that the salt of a substance has some percentage of the active substance in relation to some other.

requirements.value: Element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship.amount[x]` is part of an existing definition because parent element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship` requires a cross-version extension. Note that the target element context `SubstanceSpecification.relationship.amount[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `SubstanceSpecification.relationship`. Element `SubstanceDefinition.relationship.amount[x]` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `SubstanceSpecification.relationship.amount[x]`, but has no comparisons. definition.value: A numeric factor for the relationship, for instance to express that the salt of a substance has some percentage of the active substance in relation to some other.
